pageContext.claim: “An all concrete Wall was NEVER ABANDONED, as has been reported by the media. Some areas will be all concrete but the experts at Border Patrol prefer a Wall that is see through (thereby making it possible to see what is happening on both sides). Makes sense to me!”
pageContext.analysis: In this tweet, Trump denies he abandoned an all-concrete but then goes on to confirm as much. He was responding to comments from an interview that his departing chief of staff John Kelly gave to the Los Angeles Times. "To be honest, it's not a wall," Kelly said. "The president still says ‘wall’ — oftentimes frankly he'll say ‘barrier’ or ‘fencing,’ now he’s tended toward steel slats. But we left a solid concrete wall early on in the administration, when we asked people what they needed and where they needed it.” Indeed, Trump has moved the goalposts from an all-concrete wall to a see-through steel fence in his public comments.
